title: Exxon Mobil Calls Emissions Inquiry a ‘Political Witch Hunt’
summary: The oil company has accused Eric T. Schneiderman, the New York attorney general, of abusing the powers of his office in his investigation of the company.

title: A Stagnant General Electric Will Replace the C.E.O. Who Transformed It
summary: The industrial giant, whose jet engines propel air travelers and whose generators light millions of households, declared that it would be installing its first new leader in 16 years.

title: The G.E. Puzzle, and the Pieces a New Chief Will Have to Make Fit
summary: John Flannery, named to lead General Electric, is reviewing its portfolio of businesses — some of them core properties, others prospectively for sale.

title: OPEC Took Aim at U.S. Oil Producers, but Hurt Itself, Too
summary: The Saudi-led cartel thought low prices would squeeze American shale output. Now its effort to reverse course is proving difficult to pull off.

title: After Surge in Orders, Airlines Now Balk at Wide-Bodies
summary: Airbus has pulled ahead of Boeing in orders for smaller planes by installing new engines and other improvements on its A320 and A321 jets.

title: Paris Air Show Faces Head Winds, and Britain Looks at Fox’s Bid to Buy Sky
summary: Aviation analysts predict an aircraft sales slowdown that could last years. Meanwhile, regulators consider a proposed takeover of a British satellite provider by 21st Century Fox.

title: ‘Is There a Man I Can Talk To?’: Stories of Sexism in the Workplace
summary: The New York Times asked women to share their experiences about how they have been treated in the workplace.

title: Libya’s Increased Oil Production Thwarts OPEC’s Reduction Plans
summary: Despite the country’s political instability, its production has grown to 885,000 barrels a day, undercutting OPEC’s efforts to shrink supplies worldwide.

title: Saudi Prince’s Elevation Will Have Far-Reaching Consequences in Energy
summary: Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s becoming heir to the throne makes him an even more influential voice in global oil circles.

title: Tesla in Talks to Set Up Electric Car Factory in Shanghai
summary: The company said foreign production was needed to make its models more affordable overseas. Its plan for a plant would require a Chinese partner.

title: Feel the Noise: Homemade Slime Becomes Big Business
summary: The market for slime — a sticky substance in a multitude of colors — is thriving in a cottage industry run by fourth-graders, teenagers and young adults.

title: Waymo and Avis Reach Deal Over Self-Driving Cars’ Maintenance
summary: Avis Budget Group, a car-rental company, will perform basic upkeep on the fleet of self-driving minivans Waymo is deploying in the Phoenix area.

title: Puerto Rico’s Power Authority Effectively Files for Bankruptcy
summary: The government said the move was the only way to reduce the existing debt of the Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority “to a sustainable level.”

title: Total Signs Deal With Iran, Exposing It to Big Risks and Rewards
summary: The agreement sets a path for other Western energy companies, but it exposes the French energy giant to the possibility that the Trump administration will add sanctions to Iran.

title: Qatar to Ramp Up Gas Production Amid Feud With Arab Neighbors
summary: The Persian Gulf state, which is under a blockade by Saudi Arabia and others in the region, says it will lift output 30 percent in the next five to seven years.

title: Volvo, Betting on Electric, Moves to Phase Out Conventional Engines
summary: It is the first mainstream automaker to sound the death knell of the traditional engine, saying that starting in 2019 all the models it introduces will be either hybrids or powered solely by batteries.

title: Oil Exports, Illegal for Decades, Now Fuel a Texas Port Boom
summary: Crude from West Texas shale fields is increasingly making its way abroad as a pipeline system is expanded to take it to market through Corpus Christi.

title: Allen & Co.’s Meeting of the Moguls, and Yellen Goes to Congress
summary: The annual technology and media conference takes place in Idaho. Janet Yellen could make her final appearances before Congress as head of the Federal Reserve.

title: Germany’s Siemens Says Russian Partner Violated Crimea Sanctions
summary: The incident threatens to strain relations between the two countries and demonstrates how energy has become a weapon in Russia’s struggle with Ukraine.

title: Venezuela Musicians Rise Up After Violist, 18, Is Killed at Protest
summary: Political unrest is testing the loyalties of many who have benefited from the socialist-oriented government, including musicians outraged by the shooting of an unarmed teenager.

title: To Little Fanfare, Muammar el-Qaddafi’s Son Is Freed in Libya
summary: A militia’s release of Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi was a direct challenge to the International Criminal Court, which wants him tried on charges of war crimes.

title: On a Tiny Norwegian Island, America Keeps an Eye on Russia
summary: In a sleepy town in the Arctic, the business of snooping on Russia’s fleet of nuclear submarines is flourishing thanks to an American-funded radar system.

title: Both Climate Leader and Oil Giant? A Norwegian Paradox
summary: While Norway wants to wean its own citizens off fossil fuels, it remains one of the world’s biggest petroleum producers and is revving up exports.

title: Saudi King Rewrites Succession, Replacing Heir With Son, 31
summary: The removal of the crown prince is a stark upheaval in the leadership of the wealthy kingdom, a key ally of the United States and the Arab world’s largest economy.

title: Why Migrants Keep Risking All on the ‘Deadliest Route’
summary: The grim fates of two Senegalese brothers match those of a growing number of young African men who are determined to reach Europe — or die trying.

title: Ghana Court Rejects Resettlement of Guantánamo Bay Detainees
summary: The Supreme Court justices ruled that Ghana’s government erred in approving the transfer of two Yemeni detainees.

title: Angola’s Corrupt Building Boom: ‘Like Opening a Window and Throwing Out Money’
summary: Angola’s reconstruction presented the politically connected with an opportunity to enrich themselves and their relatives.

title: Trump’s Anti-Nafta Stance Is on a Collision Course with Natural Gas
summary: Mexico’s economy and U.S. energy companies depend on free-flowing cross-border natural gas. Both are scrambling to avoid the chaotic disruption of a trade war.

title: Police Officers in Helicopter Attack Venezuela’s Supreme Court
summary: The attack, with grenades, was a rare act of disloyalty against a government under pressure from protests and an economic collapse.

title: On London’s Streets, Black Cabs and Uber Fight for a Future
summary: London’s cabby wars are less about the disruptive power of an app, or a new business model, than about the disruption of Britain.

title: For Russia, Trump-Putin Meeting Is a Sure Winner
summary: In Moscow’s view, whatever Mr. Trump does, whether cooperating with the Russian leader or stonewalling him, he will come out looking the weaker party.
